byline.original: By NICK WINGFIELD and BRIAN STELTER

abstract: Reed Hastings, chief executive of Netflix, says missteps, including an unpopular price cut and a scrapped plan to divide into two companies, led to loss of 800,000 subscribers in the third quarter; company's stock plummets more than 25 percent on the news but performed well financially with a reported net income of $62.5 million, or $1.16 a share.
snippet: Reed Hastings, the chief executive, talks about the missteps that cost subscribers and sent the stock plunging.
lead_paragraph: Reed Hastings, the chief executive, talks about the missteps that cost subscribers and sent the stock plunging.

headline.main: How Netflix Lost 800,000 Members, and Good Will
headline.seo: Netflix Lost 800,000 Members With Price Rise and Qwikster Plan
